text: Hi Everyone! I had a question about themes and the marketplace. Typically, I build / create on my local machine and then push changes up to HubSpot. There have been times, that I just wipe the entire theme folder out and upload a fresh copy. How does this work with having a theme on the Marketplace and wanting to push updates / versions to that theme? Do I need to leave the folder there and just push updates into the folder to be able to edit the main product listing, or what is the best practice for wanting to push updates to your theme in the marketplace?
Also, for the Hackathon submission, do we submit our themes normally through our portal, and then go back and submit that to the Hackathon? I want to make sure my theme gets entered properly

With the newly updated marketplace guidelines to not include <http://preview.hs-sites.com|preview.hs-sites.com> links to preview page layouts, I am wondering what we should do for marketplace listings that are system pages? a 404 page we could create with a bad url, but the system error 500 error may be more difficult :laughing:
the recommendation is to use `{hubId}.<http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com>`  cc <@U2H3TT8F2>

Kacper is correct, using the `{hubID}.<http://hs-sites.com|hs-sites.com>` would be the way to go. If you generate a preview a link from the DM, you should be able to replace the word `preview` with your portal ID.
Hey Sam, for this question, yes, you would submit the theme as normal through your provider account and then hop over to Devpost to submit the entry form there.

Hi <@U2H3TT8F2>! Perfect!

I am running into a small submission issue. On the last page of the theme submission, it says I have an error in my header and footer. When I go look at those global modules, there are no errors in HubSpot. When I look at the base theme, it shows an eslinting warning, but no errors. Any ideas?
I can provide some screenshots if needed. Sorry to keep bugging you. I was trying super hard to get this submitted today, and my day got wrecked by other things :smile:
Hey Sam, would you be able to send a screenshot of the error over to me in a DM so i can look at it?
